title: Dad dared boy to dress up as hot dog for school photo with comical results
text:
Jake Arsenault happily took up his dad Craig’s dare to dress a hot dog for his school photo – with the amusing results subsequently sweeping the internet (Picture: Craig Arsenault)

A dad dared his son to dress up as a hot dog for his school photo – with the resulting snap leaving the family in hysterics.

Craig Arsenault told nine year-old Jake it would ‘be legendary’ if he wore his planned Halloween costume to Biddeford Intermediate School in Scarborough, Maine, for the ID photo.

Craig also promised the youngster $10 if he took him up on the dare – with the youngster’s sausage-encased face now sweeping the internet.

The light-hearted dad shared the comical snap on Facebook, and wrote: ‘My wife and I dared our son to wear a hotdog costume for school pictures.

‘The school let him do it, and I couldn’t be happier.’

Jake pulled off the prank at Biddeford Intermediate School in Connecticut last week, but he is still owed $3 of the $10 his dad said he’d pay him for wearing the silly outfit (Picture: Google Maps)

Craig’s wife Kari wrote the school a letter explaining the dare, saying: ‘We are aware and OK with Jacob Arsenault’s intention to wear his hot dog costume for school pictures, if possible.’

USA Today reported that Craig still has to make good on his side of the dare – with a shortage of cash meaning Jake has only collected $7 of the $10 he is owed.

The youngster posed for another photo in regular clothing, with that snap used on a spare copy of school ID.

Craig said Jake has loved the attention his prank has brought.

He added that the youngster only has one regret – that he chose to wear the costume on a school half-day, rather than getting to enjoy it for a normal-length day of classes.
description: Fearless Jake Arsenault was happy to take his dad Craig up on the dare last week at Biddeford Middle School in Maine
